info.title: EAPI-Crypto
info.description: This Open API represents the collection of InComm's "Security as a Service" functions. Currently enabled calls center on point-to-point ('P2P') encryption, plus supporting token and API health operations.  Authentication is performed via OIDC/Oauth2.

post.description: Use this operation to accept encrypted data and return unencrypted, clear-text data. [Currently **not** supported.]
Use this operation to accept unencrypted, clear-text data and return encrypted data under a specified key and encryption type. [Currently **not** supported.]

get.description: Use this operation to obtain the latest public (PKI) key in use. [Currently **not** supported.]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A value to be assigned by InComm to the calling organization in order to identify itself.

post.description: Perform crypto service management operations [Currently **not** supported.]

Use this operation to tokenize the PAN using a destination provider's tokenization service. The service decrypts using the method and key provided in the request and returns the token. Additionally, the caller can elect to receive the card's expiration date back as clear text data.

Use this operation to translate one or more blocks of secure, encrypted data. The service decrypts using the method and key provided in the request and returns one or blocks of data encrypted under a service provider's encryption method and current key. Additionally, the caller can elect to receive the card's expiration date back as clear text data.

example.description: Missing required parameters in request body

get.description: This operation is used to get health status of the interface. The caller should implement this call as a regularly-timed heartbeat operation (best practice is a two-minute interval). InComm will use a record of these calls to determine which API originators are in good health. The absence of these calls will result in a phone call from InComm's Network Operations Center.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A value to be assigned by InComm to the calling organization in order to identify itself.

get.summary: Obtain a status about the health of the interface (also used by InComm to ensure a well-functioning caller)

get.description: This operation is used to get current Application and Swagger API Spec versions.
get.summary: Obtain current Application and Swagger API Spec versions

post.description: Provide username and password to receive a JWT Bearer Token.  Use this  token on requests requiring authentication.

post.summary: Refresh an accessToken through this endpoint
post.description: Provide the refreshToken received in a previous /auth/token or /auth/token/refresh response in order to obtain another valid accessToken

ValidToken.description: Credentials or refreshToken accepted, new valid token to be used for authentication returned

CardholderTokenResponse.description: Card Holder Data Tokenize operation response

encrypt.description: A directive to the service as to which pieces of information to return encrypted. NOTE: Expiration date in this field is ONLY AVAILABLE for Verizon

clear.description: A directive to the service as to which pieces of information to return in the clear.

format.description: A directive to the service as to which format should be used for a given type of information.

type.description: Data Type -- Currently, expiration date ('EXP') is the only requested type where the format directive applies. If EXP is requested and the caller does not supply a 'format' directive, then the service uses 'YYMM' as the format.

pattern.description: Format Pattern -- The caller can ask to see data returned in 'YYMM', 'MMYY' or 'MM/YYYY' format (either as a clear or encrypted value)

secureData.description: An array of one more pieces of encrypted data

data.description: Data encrypted under the specified key ID

type.description: Data Type -- Describes the content of the data provided. The data can be either of the two tracks ('TRACK1', 'TRACK2'), or all the tracks together ('ALL_TRACKS'). The details of how that data is represented is described in the 'encryptionMethod' and 'format' fields.

keyId.description: Key Identifier ('ID') -- The current public key (distributed by InComm to the transaction originator) if the method is 'RSA_OAEP'.

encryptionMethod.description: Describes the method used to secure the data via encryption. The only currently defined method is 'RSA_OAEP' (RSA public key encryption with Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding applied).

format.description: Describes how the originating application arranged the data prior to securing it. The only currently defined format is 'CONCAT'  which can be used in conjunction with 'ALL_TRACKS'. In this approach, the device concatenates the track data -- Tracks 1, 2 (and, if present, Track 3) into a single string, including start and end sentinels and no other characters added to artificially separate the tracks. This field is optional, meaning that if it's not present 'default' format will be assumed.

destination.description: Destination -- The service provider who will produce the encrypted result

clientId.description: Client ID -- Value supplied by InComm to the caller; to be provided in all executions

clearData.description: Clear text values -- Can contain 'EXP' data type if request directives ask for it

data.description: Clear Data (provided as per the directives in the request).

secureData.description: Data re-encrypted under a method and key supplied by the service provider (provided as per the directives in the request).

keyId.description: Key Identifier ('ID') used by the service provider (along with the encryption method) to produce the secure data result

encryptionMethod.description: Encryption Method employed by the service provider (along withe key ID) to produce the secure data result

description.example: Missing required parameters in request body

accessToken.description: accessToken to be used to make authenticated requests

expiresIn.description: Number of seconds until the accessToken expires

refreshToken.description: Refresh Token allows the application to ask API to issue a new Access Token without having to re-authenticate the user. This will work as long as the Refresh Token has not been revoked

refreshExpiresIn.description: Number of seconds until the refreshToken expires

tokenType.description: Type of token that has been returned
